paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on a somatic BRCA2 mutation in a patient with pancreatic squamous cell carcinoma, including penetrance data.

patients.phenotype: Stage IV pancreatic squamous cell carcinoma

individual_records.phenotype_details: Stage IV pancreatic squamous cell carcinoma
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A sequencing performed on the biopsied specimen revealed a stop-gain mutation in BRCA2 exon 11 (c.1830A>T, p.K944*).

functional_data.summary: The mutation is reported as a pathogenic germline mutation.

variants.additional_notes: The patient had a long overall survival of 21 months.
key_quotes: A sequencing performed on the biopsied specimen revealed a stop-gain mutation in BRCA2 exon 11 (c.1830A>T, p.K944*).

Our case demonstrated a favorable clinical activity and survival advantage of the combined cisplatin and nanoparticle albumin-bound paclitaxel, which might serve as a therapeutic option for the patient with BRCA-mutant pancreatic SCC.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the BRCA2 variant.
